name: osmcoastline
description: Extracts coastline data from OpenStreetMap planet file

repo.name: osmcoastline
repo.description: Extracts coastline data from OpenStreetMap planet file.

readme.summary: Well-structured technical documentation with clear prerequisites and build steps, but lacks practical examples and troubleshooting guidance for common use cases.
readme.top_issue: Missing real-world usage examples and troubleshooting guidance - the README explains what outputs are created but provides minimal examples of how to actually use the tool for typical coastline extraction workflows

injection_risks.description: SQL string concatenation in set_options function
SQL string concatenation in set_meta function

critical_findings: SQL injection vulnerability in set_options and set_meta functions
Potential information disclosure through error messages
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including SQL injection vulnerabilities and potential information disclosure through error messages, but no critical secrets or credentials are exposed.

common_complaints: Invalid geometry output (ESRI shapes with type 0, empty GPKG features)
Coastline orientation and validity problems (holes outside shells, reversed coastlines)
Data quality issues (incomplete water polygons, estuaries not handled)
Test suite fragility (failures with GEOS 3.9.1 and geometry library updates)
sentiment.summary: osmcoastline shows moderate maintenance activity with issues resolved over time, but persistent dependency compatibility problems and complex geometric edge cases indicate an aging C++ project struggling with evolving GDAL/GEOS ecosystems.

red_flags: Assuming external factors without proper investigation
communication.summary: The maintainer provides technical insights but could be more welcoming and ensure clearer resolutions.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months
No merged PRs in the past 6 months
No closed issues in the past 6 months
No active contributors in the past 6 months
3 open issues with no resolution activity
positive_signals: Last commit exists (January 2026), showing project is not completely abandoned
maintenance.summary: osmcoastline appears stale with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months despite having open issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-structured, clearly marks breaking changes, and is comprehensive and clear, but lacks migration guides.

project_metrics.description: Extracts coastline data from OpenStreetMap planet file.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good overview of the package and its usage, but could benefit from more examples and troubleshooting guidance.
